title: Getting Rid of Fraction Denominators
text: What is the LCD (largest common denominator) of $$\frac{3}{2}$$, $$\frac{1}{3}$$, and $$\frac{2}{3}$$?

title: Getting Rid of Fraction Denominators
text: We must now multiply both sides of the equation by 6 and use the distributive property, so we have $$6\frac{3}{2} z+6\frac{1}{3}=6z-6\frac{2}{3}$$. This simplifies to $$9z+2=6z-4$$.

title: Solving the New Equation
text: To solve this equation, we must isolate the "z" term.

title: Solving the New Equation
text: To isolate the "z" term, we can begin by subtracting 6z from both sides of the equation. We now have $$3z+2=-4$$.

title: Solving the New Equation
text: Now, we must subtract 2 from both sides so that only the "z" term is on the left-hand side. We now get $$3z=-6$$.

title: Solving the New Equation
text: Finally, we can divide both sides by 3 to get the "z" term by itself on the left-hand side. What is the value of z?
